Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `curl|bash` is probably ok in a throwaway docker container, except when it's some crazy VM escape bug üòÖ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: My containers infrastracture working similar way - from container I'm using only envinroment, then needed binaries downloading by wget and all setup/start doing by script

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: But it's very unsecure yes, thats why it's close-sourced üòÉ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
``` 
FROM ubuntu:18.04 

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y python wget libboost-dev libboost-system-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev libcurl3-gnutls curl libssl-dev && wget some_server/start.sh && chmod u+x start.sh

EXPOSE 7782 7783 38880 38890 38900

CMD ./start.sh```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Massive docker container code of mm2 node with download script / run it concept üòÉ And start.sh downloading and executing other scripts and binary

Author: Marabou#8038
Content: Hi everyone, i am new to komodo and i am trying to understand all the functionalities. If I want to create an AssetChain with parameter ac_staked=100 , how can I choose which nodes can stake ? I mean can i configure my chain as a dPOS ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 100% PoS chain is staked by the coins that exist

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: distribute coins to the nodes you want to allow to stake

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is very important to have good coin distribution for a 100% PoS chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we have NOTHING to do with dPoS

Author: Marabou#8038
Content: Ok thanks @jl777c , i also don't like dPOS but i'm forced to use it for my work project . But if I want users executing transactions of my coin in my chain but only some nodes are validating ? I mean can I allow only some nodes to validate ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all full nodes validate all transactions and blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you could setup SPV servers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then the lite clients wont be validating all the transactions

Author: Marabou#8038
Content: Ok thank you for the informations. Also i thank you for your work with komodo which is always innovating and not trying to overhype

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: thanks for your support!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: currently i can't compile hush on my main dev machine, so I will spin some wheels trying to fix this. Living on the bleeding edge, I chose this life :abusedsmily:

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i merged sapling viewkeys into hush

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I was happy to see radix42 submit that PR, I had eyed that exact code and shook my head that ZEC didn't merge it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: The PR actually has some of the nicest ZEC tests I have seen, but still not good enough for ZEC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: they wanted to think more about the external representation of IVKs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I think KMD can just do our own thing at this point

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Our IVKs may be in a different format/etc, and that is fine

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ZEC has some reasonable concerns, I just don't think it's worth not having anything to play with

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Current IVKs have the "issue" where you MUST keep track of the zaddr they correspond to, externally

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's not in the viewkey

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what is the I in IVK?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so if you lose that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: INCOMING VIEW KEY

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "read-only" view key, you can only see incoming xtns, not outgoing

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: AS for Arrr around the cornerüôÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you lose the corresponding zaddr of a IVK, you must brute force search all of chain history, just like z_importkey

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's ... less than ideal, but hey, still better than nothing

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ZEC wants to embed some data into the viewkey to make it faster to find the zaddr associated with it, but they don't have any good solutions

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: or don't care

Content: @Alright you probably had the private key AND viewkey imported to your wallet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it works well enough for atomic swaps

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's perfectly sufficient, it has the necessary data

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: My suggestions are more for future-proofing and efficiency under edge cases

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If you, a KMD developer have 1000 viewkeys laying around, good luck knowing which chain and which network on that chain they go to

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is why I think embedding asset chain name into the base58 prefix would be a good KMD addition

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you need to know z address along with viewing key

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so there is other data needed to be stored along side them anyway

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: What I am saying is, ZEC didn't merge this because they want to embed that extra data into the IVK

Content: I agree with James, I want to have something to play with

Content: "good enough" is much better than "nothing"
